intro: Diplazium wahauense, commonly known as the New Zealand cliff fern, is a species of fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Hypnaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features dark green, leathery fronds with a distinctive, serrated margin. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocky slopes and cliff faces. Diplazium wahauense plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
